channel.title: Source has no cmd
channel.description: How can i make a source bat file to make it run, i tried copying one and changing it to get to the jar files but then it says cannot find main class server.server.

item.title: Source has no cmd
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Mango52, post:5, topic:451859”]facepalm.jpg

Eclipse is for development, you still need a way to deploy client/server.
To run the server out of Eclipse, you still need to know the main class.[/quote]

You can run a server in the eclipse development environment by clicking the big green arrow that says has a little pop up saying ‘run as’.

Read full topic

item.title: Source has no cmd
item.dc:creator: @Mango52 Mango52
item.description:
@Mango52 wrote:

This will work. Save it as “run.bat” in the same folder that contains the bin folder (not in the bin folder).

@echo off title Server java -Xmx512m server.server pause

Read full topic

item.title: Source has no cmd
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Just use an IDE. Eclispe is great, also if you don’t know how to run a server using eclispe I recommend this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eoYKZ2xoXLM

Read full topic

item.title: Source has no cmd
item.dc:creator: @Mango52 Mango52
item.description:
@Mango52 wrote:

What source are you using? Assuming your source doesn’t have any dependencies, this is a generic run.bat:

@echo off title Server java -Xmx512m server.Server pause
Change “server.Server” to your main class, normally named something called something like “Server.class”. This is different on many sources, so you’ll have to find yours.

Read full topic
